current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish the Commission on Effective Regulation and
		  Assessment Systems for Public Schools.

Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

			 Assessment Systems for Public Schools Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Commission on
			 Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

means the Commission on Effective Regulation and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the
of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

header.#text:
Establishment
				of Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public
				Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Commission on Effective Regulation and
				Assessment Systems for Public Schools Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				establish a commission to be known as the

term.#text:
Commission on Effective
				Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
examine the
				quality and purpose of current Federal, State, and local assessment
				requirements; and

make
				recommendations to improve and align assessment systems to provide quality and
				meaningful information for parents, teachers, and students to improve student
				achievement, teacher performance, and innovation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be composed of—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
2 State officials
				responsible for administering Federal education programs;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall solicit input and nominations for appointing members of the
				Commission from—

text.#text:
superintendents,
				principals, teachers, and other members of the education community; and

parents,
				students, and other members of the general public.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall determine the membership of the Commission after considering
				recommendations submitted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:10002/ss:c/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall designate a Governor as the Chairperson of the
				Commission.

shall hold, at the call of the Chairperson, at least 1 meeting every
				6 months. All such meetings shall be open to the public. The Commission may
				hold, at the call of the Chairperson, such other meetings as the Chairperson
				sees fit to carry out this title.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall constitute a quorum, but a
				lesser number of members may hold hearings.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
A
				majority of the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Commission on Effective Regulation and
				Assessment Systems for Public Schools Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall hold its first meeting not later
				than 60 days after the date of enactment of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall hold such hearings, sit and act at
				such times and places, take such testimony, and receive such evidence as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines appropriate to carry out this title.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall consider inviting
				witnesses from, among other groups—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
In
				hearings held under this subsection, the

Federal, State,
				and local educational agency personnel;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
any other
				individuals determined appropriate by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may secure directly from any
				Federal department or agency such information as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
considers
				necessary to carry out this title. Upon request of the Chairperson, the head of
				such department or agency shall furnish such information to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools
Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take such actions as it determines
				necessary to gain a full understanding of the issues of effective regulation
				and assessment systems for public schools.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				focus—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
in examining the
				over-regulation of public schools, on—

examining
				Federal, State, and local regulations governing public schools;

identifying
				which government entity requires each regulation;

investigating
				how Federal, State, and local interpretations of laws and regulations create
				additional or unnecessary burden and are used as rationale for imposing
				requirements that are not actually mandated by law; and

in examining the
				effective testing of public schools, on—

determining the
				purpose and intent of each such test or assessment, including whether it is
				intended to measure student achievement and growth, teacher and principal
				effectiveness, or system accountability;

reporting on the
				quality of standardized assessments;

examining
				reporting practices of test results and the degree to which the results are
				returned in a timely manner with sufficient quality to be useful to parents,
				teachers and principals, and students to inform and improve their work,
				including targeting instruction to student needs, grading student work, and
				evaluating teacher and principal effectiveness;

analyzing the
				ability of quality assessments to measure whether a student is prepared to
				graduate from high school and pursue college or a career without the need for
				academic remediation;

determining the
				technology infrastructure required for next generation assessments; and

identifying
				opportunities to improve assessment practices to better promote parent, teacher
				and principal, and student understanding of progress toward college and career
				readiness and public understanding of school performance and educational
				productivity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may rely on samples of
				States and local school districts for examples of regulations and testing
				requirements.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
In
				conducting its work under this title, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:10004/ss:b/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide
				regular reports in a manner and form of the Commission's choosing to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
;
				and

text.#text:
the members of
				the relevant committees.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and annually thereafter, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall issue a report
				to—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
Not later than 1 year after the date of the first meeting
				of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
;
				and

text.#text:
the members of
				the relevant committees.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
making
				recommendations for Federal, State, and local policy makers; and

broadly
				disseminate such report to the general public.

The
				Chairperson shall annually provide testimony to the relevant committees.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall serve without
				compensation in addition to any such compensation received for the member's
				service as an officer or employee of the United States, if applicable.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be allowed travel
				expenses, including per diem in lieu of subsistence, at rates authorized for
				employees of agencies under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, while away from their homes or regular places of business in the
				performance of services for the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: usc-chapter/5/57/1
Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide assistance to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Assistant Secretary for Elementary and Secondary
				Education

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , upon request of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , without reimbursement.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
without reimbursement, and such detail shall be
				without interruption or loss of civil service status or
				privilege.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission on Effective Regulation and Assessment Systems for Public Schools

text.#text:
Any Federal Government employee may be

				for Public Schools
